pages.text: By the star when it sets
Your companion neither went astray nor was he misled
nor does he speak out of (his own) desire
It is nothing but a communication, communicated
One (Jibraeel) severe in strength, made it known to him
(he) possesses vigor so he sought equilibrium
when he was on the high horizon
Then he came near and he came down
and was at a distance of two bows, length or closer
then he communicated to His servant that which he communicated
The heart did not lie (in communicating) what it saw
What ! do you dispute with him as to what he saw
And he indeed saw him (Jibraeel) in another descent
near the farthest lote tree
near which is the garden for staying
when that covered the lote tree which covered
The sight neither deviated nor exceeded the limits
He indeed saw (some) of the greater signs of his Fosterer
Did you (ever) see Al Lat and Al Uzza
and Manat the third (and) the last (idol)
What! for you the males and for Him the females
Then that is an unfair division

They are nothing but names which you have named, you and your fathers, for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and that which their souls desire, though the guidance has come to them from their Fosterer
Or, shall man have what (all) he desires
But Allahâ€™s is the hereafter (future) and the former (past)
And how many an angel is there in the skies, whose recommendation will be of no use in anything, except after Allah gives permission to whom He wills and pleases
